tool.name: Generate pileup format
tool.command:
## Need to set the home directory to the current working directory, ## else the tool tries to write to home/.ncbi and fails when used ## with a cluster manager. export HOME=\$PWD; vdb-config --restore-defaults; vdb-config -s "/repository/user/main/public/root=\$PWD"; #if ( str( $region ) == "" ): ASCP_PATH=`which ascp`; ASCP_KEY=`dirname \$ASCP_PATH`/asperaweb_id_dsa.openssh; prefetch --ascp-path "\$ASCP_PATH|\$ASCP_KEY" "$input.accession"; ##Duplicate vdb-config, in case settings changed between prefetch and ##dump command. #end if vdb-config -s "/repository/user/main/public/root=\$PWD"; sra-pileup --log-level fatal #if str( $region ) != "":
--aligned-region "$region"
#end if #if str( $minMapq ) != "": --minmapq "$minMapq" #end if #if $input.input_select == "file": "$input.file" > "$output_file" #elif $input.input_select == "accession_number": "$input.accession" > "$output_accession" #elif $input.input_select == "text": `cat $input.text` > "$output_text" #end if
tool.help: This tool produces pileup format from sra archives using sra-pileup. The sra-pileup program is developed at NCBI, and is available at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Traces/sra/sra.cgi?view=software. @SRATOOLS_ATTRRIBUTION@
